loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Don Francisco, trabaja vendiendo de manera ambulante, se ayuda junto a su esposa quien le apoya en vender los productos de cosméticos, el viaja a diferentes departamentos del país para ofrecer sus productos y lograr hacer unas ventas, siendo su único medio de ingreso que le ayuda a mantener su hogar y los gastos de colegio de sus hijos quienes dependen de él. Solicita crédito para invertir en su pequeño negocio ya que carece de productos suficientes para comercializar.
texts.en: Francisco works as a traveling salesman. He is helped by his wife, who supports him in selling cosmetics. He travels to different departments of the country to offer his products and make some sales, as this business is the only source of income that helps him maintain his home and cover the school expenses of his children, who depend on him. He is requesting a loan to invest in his small business, as he lacks sufficient products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther is single and 37 years old. She could not attend high school after her junior high school certificate, and she has one child. She sells provisions such as milk, Milo and rice. She set up this business on a table top and now has five years of experience. She has been able to erect a small store close to her residence.

Esther organized these ladies, and their group is requesting a total loan amount of GHS 2,650. The loan will be used to buy sugar, salad oil, rice, beans, eggs, and women's clothing. 

In the near future, Esther wishes to open a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, milk and Milo and sell to customers.

loans.name: Prossy's Group

texts.en:
Prossy's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Prossy is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. For the past two years, Prossy has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells fresh foods. 

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food such as bananas and cassava to sell, and will help Prossy to generate greater profits and take care of herself and her children. Prossy hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Prossy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food such as bananas and cassava to sell

loans.name: Sarah's Group

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stationery items such as books, pens, staples and computer accessories, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and improve her family's living standard. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to have a very good stable financial life. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more stationery items such as books, pens, staples and computer accessories.

The loan will be used to buy more seeds for planting since it’s a rainy season, and will help Annet to generate greater profits and boost her business and even open up a retail shop. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more seeds for planting in the rainy season

The loan will be used to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell, and will help Hadija to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young child. loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, skirts and more.

loans.name: Gloria Arminda

texts.es: Doña gloria de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, Ella posee un taller de costura en el lugar de su residencia donde confecciona diferentes tipos de prendas, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque el trabajo que ella realiza es excelente y los elabora a precios realmente accesibles; élla es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo y responsable, gloria esta solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar: telas, hilos, agujas, y todo lo relacionado con la costura para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de los clientes y asi ella y su esposo podran tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Gloria is 57 years old and lives in her own home with her husband.  She has a sewing workshop in her home where she make different items of clothing.  Lately she has gained many new customers because she does excellent work at affordable prices.  Gloria is very dedicated and responsible with her work.  She is applying for a loan that will allow her to buy material, threads, needles and other dressmaking items so as to continue fulfilling her customers needs.  With this work, Gloria and her husband will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy threads, material and needles for dressmaking.

loans.name: Hajirah

texts.en:
Hajirah is 16 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past two years, Hajirah has been working hard to manage her small hotel, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Hajirah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more saucepans, more sacks of rice and maize flour, and will help Hajirah to generate greater profits and pay rent for the hotel. Hajirah hopes that in the future she will be able to start selling fast foods. 

Hajirah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock more saucepans, more sacks of rice and maize flour.

loans.name: Neftali De Jesus

texts.es: don neftali de 55 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 25 años y eso le ha dado la experiencia para asistir sus cultivos su principal siembra es el maiz y el sorgo, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de compra-venta de granos basicos que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, el esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos agricolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y tambien para darle una mejora a su terreno para tener una mejor cosecha y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitacion.
texts.en: Neftali is 55 years old and has been working in agriculture for 25 years.  This work has given him experience in looking after his crops.  Neftali mainly grows corn and sorghum and sells his products in to local agencies that buy and sell basic grains.  With his profits, Neftali helps with family costs.  He lives in his own house with his wife and two children. Heftali is applying for a loan so that he can buy farming supplies that will help with sowing crops, such as manure, seeds and fertliser.  This will also help improve the land and produce a better yield, and thus a better income to continue supporting with household costs.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Olga Margarita

texts.es: olga de 29 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia y sus 2 hijos ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal como lociones, cremas, shampoos, desodorantes, entre otras cosas,con las ventas que realiza cubre algunos gastos de su hogar, tiene mucha clientela ya que los productos que ella vende son de muy buena calidad por eso solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar mas mercaderia para surtir su negocio y tener mas ganancias para seguirle dando a su familia lo que necesitan
texts.en: Olga is 29 years old and lives in her own house with her family and two children.  Olga makes a living selling personal products such as lotions, creams, shampoos and deodorant.  With her sales, Olga is able to cover some of her household costs.  She has many customers as she sells very high quality products.  Because of this she is applying for a loan to buy more merchandise to stock up her business and have high profits so that she can continue to give her family what they need.

loans.use: to buy products (perfumes, creams and more).

loans.name: Asiina

texts.en:
Asiina is 16 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past five months, Asiina has been working hard to manage her stationery shop. 

To help expand her business, Asiina has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a computer to help her provide secretarial services, and will help Asiina to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Asiina hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a video library. 

Asiina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy a computer to help her provide secretarial services.

loans.name: Enrique Roberto Eduardo

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 63 años y vive en la ciudad de Ica al lado de su esposa con quien tiene 2 hijos a quienes quiere muchísimo y por quienes trabaja muy duro para poder brindarles una vida digna y sobre todo mucho amor. Desde joven Roberto tuvo la necesidad de trabajar para poder apoyar a sus padres, por ello solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar ingeniería mecánica.

Día a día Roberto trabaja como chofer de taxi, el recorre las calles de la ciudad en busca de clientes y también trabaja como agricultor, ya que tiene una parcela y en ella siembra productos de pan llevar, con lo cual tiene un ingreso extra; él cree que está saliendo adelante porque es trabajador y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Roberto está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá realizar la preparación de su parcela agrícola como arado, abono y sembrío de pallares, y abono de pécanos, de esta manera el podrá sembrar sus productos y poder obtener una mejor cosecha y así mejorar sus ingresos, de esta manera el podrá seguir trabajando y esforzándose para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Comprar un terreno y tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Roberto is 63 years old and lives in the city of Ica, along with his wife. They have two children together who he loves very much and for whom he works very hard, in order to be able to offer them a dignified life and above all, love. Since he was young, Roberto has needed to work in order to support his parents. For this reason, he was only able to study until the fifth grade of secondary school, but he would have liked to study mechanical engineering.

Day in and day out, Roberto works as a taxi driver. He drives the streets of the city in search of customers and he also works as a farmer. He has a parcel of land where he grows staple products for extra income. He thinks he is doing well because he is hard working and has a great desire to get ahead.

Roberto is very grateful to Kiva borrowers because thanks to the help they have offered him, he will be able to prepare his parcel of farmland with a plow, fertilizer, lima bean seedlings, and pecan fertilizer. This way he will be able to plant his crops, achieve a better harvest, and thereby improve his income. This will make it possible for him to continue striving to make his greatest dream a reality: to buy a piece of land and have his own house.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 33 years old and married with four children.  With four children in school, Jenny works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, soap, shampoo, milk and coffee. Jenny has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.
In the future Jenny would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, soap, shampoo, milk and coffee.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie works hard to support her family. Annie is married and has a cafeteria business in the Philippines.

Annie requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business such as milk, sugar and coffee. Annie has been in this business for five years now. In the future, Annie would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business such as milk, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr:
Née vers 1972 à Bougouni, Madame Alimatou est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit son époux dans le quartier Médine de Bougouni.   
Madame Alimatou mène cette activité d’achat et de vente de charbon de bois il y’a environ dix ans. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commande en provenance surtout de Bamako. A l’approche de l’hivernage son activité devient de plus en plus danse. C’est ainsi, qu’elle décida d’adhérer au programme crédit  de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel  elle est à son 2 ème prêt individuel, le premier prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. Elle compte acheter avec ce 2 ème prêt  80 sacs de charbon de bois auprès des paysans producteurs. Elle les revendra en détail et en gros à une clientèle composée généralement de chefs de famille de la ville et des commerçants en provenance de Bamako.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs Alimatou was born circa 1972 in Bougouni. She's married and the mother of five children. She lives with her husband in the Médine neighborhood in Bougouni.

For ten years, she's been buying and selling charcoal. She enjoys a strong reputation in this business and receives a lot of orders, mainly from Bamako.

With the rainy season approaching, her business is gearing up. She decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which she's seeking her second loan. The first one was repaid without problems.

She intends to use this second loan to buy 80 sacks of charcoal from farmers. She will resell it retail and wholesale to a clientele comprising mainly heads of families and merchants coming from Bamako. 

Thanks to this loan, she intends to turn a monthly profit of XOF 50'000 (ca US$ 100), to be used to help cover family expenses and repay the loan. She will invest the remainder in her business.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena works hard to support her family. Lorena is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lorena requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. Lorena has been in this business for three years now. In the future, Lorena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to puchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice-selling business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice for her business. Elma has been in this business for five years. She also earns income from farming rice.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

Tita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.name: Corlita

Corlita has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF.

texts.en:

Antonia is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the plants. With this, she will be able to grow and harvest healthy vegetables from the garden thus allowing her to sell more to the market. In the future, Antonia hopes to make her business a success and to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the plants

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business such as paint and wood for her furniture-making business. Annabelle has been in this business for two years. She also earns income from her general store.

Annabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business such as paint and wood.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 49 years old and married with five children. Elsie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell such as soap, snack foods, spices, sugar and milk.

Elsie has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns income from buying and selling fish.

Elsie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell such as soap, snack foods, spices, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials such as fishing net, bamboo, wood and nails for her fishing business.

Jelly has been in this business for three years. Jelly also earns income from food vending.

Jelly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business such as fishing net, bamboo, wood and nails.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, six of whom are in school, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net for her fishing business

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 30 years old and married with three children.

Teresa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell, like soap, snack foods, spices, sugar, milk, etc.

Teresa has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

Teresa aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell, like soap, snack foods, spices, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente vive en Guayaquil. Comenzó a vender productos naturales, poco a poco fue incrementando su negocio. Trabajan todos los días desde muy temprano vende los productos naturales Onni Life (productos naturales). 

Una de las dificultades son los ladrones. La cliente es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos, uno de 33 años quien es un joven adulto pero con discapacidad  ella  lo tiene que cuidar, otro de 14 y 2 años de edad. 

Ella tiene muchas aspiraciones con su familia por eso quiere seguir trabajando para mejorar su negocio y darle lo mejor a sus hijos. El préstamo lo usara para mejorar sus productos naturales comprando Onni Life, para el hígado, estomago, vitaminas. En el futuro quiere tener un local d y darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Guayaquil. She started selling natural products and gradually was able to increase her business. The borrower works every day, starting in the early morning hours, selling Omnilife natural products.

One of her difficulties is dealing with thieves. The borrower is a single mother with three children. One child, age 33, is a young adult who requires her care because of a disability. The other children are ages 14 and 2.

The borrower has many aspirations for her family. For this reason, she wants to continue working to improve her business and provide the best for her children. Her loan will be used to improve her Omnilife business by purchasing natural products for the liver and stomach, as well as vitamins. In the future, she wants to acquire a shop and provide the best for her family.

loans.use: to buy Omnilife natural products, such as vitamins and remedies for the liver and stomach.

loans.name: Emelida

texts.en:
Emelida is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Jagna, Bohol. 

She earns a living through her food vending business; selling home cooked snack foods to the people in her area. Emelida is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, butter, bananas, coconut milk and cooking oil. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more thus, augmenting her sales and income. 

In the future, Emelida hopes to expand her business so that she will be able to increase her earnings and send her children to school for better learning and education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, butter, bananas, coconut milk and cooking oil

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Minda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice and buying and selling fish. Minda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Minda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is 22 years old and married with one child.

Vicky works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, snack foods, spices, sugar, milk, etc.

Vicky has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

Vicky aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, snack foods, spices, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Marilen

texts.en:
Marilen is a 42-year-old, married woman and mother to a 16-year-old.  They are from Jagna, Bohol. She operates a sari-sari or variety store selling various goods and items to the people, who live nearby.
 
Marilen is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, soda and beverages. soap and detergents, biscuits and chips. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers in her store thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Marilen hopes of making her business a success and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, soda and beverages, soap and detergents, biscuits and chips.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a two-door refrigerator as well as meats, chicken, ham, sausages, and chorizo.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is a 24-year-old woman from Garcia-Hernandez, Bohol. Noreen operates and runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people nearby. Noreen is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like rice, soda, soap and detergents, canned goods and noodles. With this, she will be able to cater to more buyers in her store which then allows her to sell more more. 

In the future, Noreen hopes to expand her business in order to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like rice, soda, soap and detergents, canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Jagna, Bohol. 

She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than five years now. Celsa is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs. 

With this, she will be able to improve her business and eventually her earnings. Moreover, Celsa dreams continually of sending her children to school for better learning and education.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Nelson Neftali

texts.es: nelson de 28 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a su familia, es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra maíz y maicillo cuando ya esta su cosecha la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografia para luego salir a comercializarlos, nelson desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Nelson, 28, is a very responsible man when it comes to his household obligations, and he has always been known for giving his family the best he can.  He works hard with cheerfulness and enthusiasm.  He is a farmer and grows corn and sorghum, and stores the harvested grain in the graineries shown in the photograph, and later sells the grain.  He wants to increase his sales volume and therefore visited the INTEGRAL offices to request a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.  

He hopes to be able to obtain the support he is requesting because he has no other income.  This will allow him to continue putting food on the family table without limitation.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Rizzy Anne Mae

texts.en:
This is Rizzy, 29, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rizzy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns her income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. She also has an RTW business for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Rizzy dreams that her business will expand and that she will have other businesses. She hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lukas

texts.es:
Lucas es un joven de 21 años de edad, lleno de sueños y metas por cumplir, cuenta que laboró por varios meses administrando un supermercado en su localidad, hasta que su padre le propuso comenzar a trabajar en un lote que ha acondicionado como parqueadero. Hoy labora en su propio negocio debido a que su padre le cedió una parte del terreno, en donde presta los servicios de parqueadero, lavado de autos y motocicletas. Con el fin de ampliar su capacidad, Lucas se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará para la construcción de ocho celdas para albergar un mayor número de vehículos.  
Su mayor sueño es seguir creciendo, adquirir conocimientos y experiencias dentro del sector, mejorando así la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucas, 21, is full of dreams and has many goals to meet.  He says he worked for several months managing a supermarket in his town, until his father proposed to him working in a parking lot.  Now he runs his own business because his father gave him part of the land, where he offers car and motorcycle parking and washing.

In order to increase his capacity, Lucas is requesting a loan to build eight parking spaces so he can hold more vehicles.  His greatest goal is to continue expanding and acquire knowledge and experience in the sector so he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To build eight vehicle parking spaces.

loans.name: Dmoa Alward Group

texts.en:
This group is called Dmoa Alward, which consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They are responsible for improving the living standards of their family. They have applied for a loan of 190,000 YER from AMB.

Suria is 28 years old, a single woman who works to provide her family. She lives in a poor area in Sana`a, Yemen. She is a nurse who has already completed her studies for a diploma. She has opened a small clinic for three years. She believes that she offers a great medical service to her patients. She is kind woman; she never took money from poor patients whose financial incomes are low. She would like to buy medical supplies to use in her clinic so she has applied for a youth loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to cover her customers' needs. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medical supplies to use in her clinic .

loans.name: Reina

texts.en: Reina is a 58-year-old, married woman and a mother of three grown up children from Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in a food vending business selling home-cooked foods to the people nearby. This is the primary source of her income. Reina is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, seasoning and rice. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more food thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Reina hopes of making her business a sustainable one.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, seasoning and rice.

loans.name: Aref

texts.en:
Aref is 33-years-old, a married man and has six children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. He works in the education ministry earning a low salary. He is smart man who thinks that his salary is not enough. 

Aref has been running a small call centre, established in house for eight years. He strives hard to meet his family's demands. He started his business with small capital provided by his father. Recently, his customers are small because of he would like to expand his business to offer for his customers what they need. So, he has applied for a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB to buy phone accessories and recharge cards to increase his profit. He would like to buy a taxi to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories and recharge cards to use for his business.

loans.name: Mamou

texts.fr:
Madame Mamou est âgée de 55 ans et mère de 8 enfants. Elle vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Dialanicoro de Bougouni. 
N’ayant pas fréquentée l’école moderne très vite elle commença à mener des activités génératrices de revenus. C’est ainsi qu’elle décida de suivre sa sœur pour apprendre l’activité d’achat et de vente des condiments. Avec une expérience de plus de 5 ans, elle maitrise cette activité dans laquelle elle est très sollicitée et appréciée dans la ville. 
Dans le cadre de l’élargissement de ses activités, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance avec qui elle est à son premier prêt qui sera  utiliser pour acheter, 6 cartons de concentrée de  tomate,  5 cartons de cube maggi, 5 sacs d’oignon, 3 bidons d’huile  et 10 sacs de sel de cuisine iodé. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Bamako et la vente se fait au grand marché de Bougouni.
Elle compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 85 000 FCFA.  Avec ce bénéfice elle envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mamou is 55 years old and a mother of eight children. She lives with her husband and children in the Dialanicoro neighborhood of Bougouni. Not having gone to school, she quickly started working to earn a living. She decided to follow her sister and learn how to buy and sell condiments. With an experience of more than five years, she is very sought after and appreciated in the town. 

In order to expand her business, she decided to join the micro-finance institution [Soro Yiriwaso]. This is her first loan and she will use it to buy 6 cartons of tomato paste, five boxes of Maggi, 5 sacs of onions, 3 cans of oil, and 10 sacs of iodized kitchen salt. She procures her goods from a large market in Bamako and sells them in a large market in Bougouni. 

With this loan, she hopes to earn an average monthly income of 85,000 francs CFA. With these earnings, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, 48-years-old, is married and has two children, a son and a daughter. Her husband earns a living working for a supermarket. Phuong supports her family through the income she earns from selling rice to the people in her community. She began this business three years ago. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Phuong intends to take a loan to buy more rice to stock her store and to pay for material to make rice sacks. The additional stock and material will enable her to increase her sales. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more rice to stock her store and material to make rice sacks.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria tiene 49 años y se dedica a la compra y venta de ropas y joyas. Tiene 3 hijos de los cuales una está trabajando en  España, y desde allí ayuda un poco a su madre con un pequeño dinero que le manda. Maria aparte de su actividad se dedica a limpiar un departamento 3 veces a la semana, ella cuenta que trabaja arduamente para poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Anteriormente trabajaba como empleada doméstica sin retiro y después empezó a trabajar como limpiadora en una empresa y de a poco empezó a comprar ropas y las vendía a sus compañeras de trabajo, se hizo de capital y empezó a vender joyas de platerías.
El sueño de la Sra. Maria es que su hija vuelva de España y así montar un salón donde pueda vender sus productos con su hija
Solicita el crédito para la compra de platerías (anillos, cadenas y pulseras, etc). Con esto podrá seguir con sus ventas y ayudando a sus hijos. Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por darle la oportunidad de acceder al crédito
texts.en:
Maria, 49, buys and sells clothing and jewelry.  She has three children, one of whom is working in Spain and sends small amounts of money to her mother when she can.  Maria also cleans an apartment three times a week and claims she works hard to be able to support her family.

She used to work as a domestic employee and then worked as a cleaning lady for a company.  Little by little she began buying and selling clothing to her co-workers, puting together enough capital to begin selling jewelery.

María's goal is for her daughter to return from Spain so they can set up a shop where both of them can work.

She is requesting a loan to buy jewelry (rings, chains and bracelets), so she can continue with her sales and help her children.  She is grateful to the Paraguaya Foundation for the opportunity to obtain a loan.

loans.use: To buy jewelry, such as rings, chains and bracelets, to sell.

loans.name: Dieu

texts.en:
Dieu is 58 years old and married with three children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife earn their income from selling soft drinks from their stall.  

Dieu started his business ten years ago. He intends to take a loan to gradually expand his business by buying a variety of different beverages and repair the stall to better serve his customers. 

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of different beverages and repair his stall.

loans.name: Mangane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mangane est marié et réside dans une famille traditionnelle avec  son épouse, ses trois enfants, son frère et autres parents à Hérémakono Nord, un des  quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Mangane n’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser dans les études, s’est initié à cette activité d’achat et de vente de radios, de radios-cassettes, de cassettes, de lunettes, etc il y a environ 7 ans. Son activité est menée à la gare routière de Bougouni avec une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales et surtout des routiers. Il est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décide d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour prendre un prêt. Il est à son premier prêt. Il veut ce prêt pour acheter à Bamako,  10 radios, 5 cartons de cassettes. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mangane is married and lives in a traditional family with this wife, his three children, his brother, and other parents in Herremakono Nord, one of the neighborhoods in the town of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of the republic of Mali). 

Mangane, not having a chance to progress in school, began his own business buying and selling radios, radio-cassette players, cassette tapes, glasses, etc. about seven years ago. He conducts his business at the Bougouni bus terminal with customers who are from all walks of life, especially drivers. He is very sought after by his customers for the quality of his products. 

In order to better satisfy his customers who are growing in number, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro-Yiriwaso and take out a loan. This is his first loan. He wants this loan to buy 10 radios and five boxes of cassette tapes from Bamako.  

He hopes to earn an average monthly income of 60,000 francs CFA, which will be used to take care of his family's expenses, pay the interest on the loan, and to invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy radios and cassette tapes

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Mariam est née vers 1966 est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle réside avec ses enfants chez son époux dans le quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquentée l’école moderne, très vite elle commença à s'intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus.
Mariam fut d’abord vendeuse de condiments, puis de chaussures et de tissus mais sans réussite.  C’est ainsi qu’elle décide alors d’accompagner sa tente pour apprendre la vente de céréales. Avec une expérience de plus de 10 ans, elle maîtrise son activité dans laquelle elle est très sollicitée.
Elle mène son activité chez elle même et au grand marché de Bougouni. Afin d’agrandir son entreprise, elle décide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, 1 tonne de maïs, 1 tonne de petit mil et 1/2 tonne de riz.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les villages  environnants.
Elle est à son sixième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés
Avec ce prêt elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 FCFA qui la permettra de subvenir à ses besoins tout en aidant son époux dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mariam was born around 1966 and is married and a mother of four children. She lives with her children at her husband's house in the Massablacoura neighborhood of Bougouni. Not having gone to school, she very quickly got started earning a living. 

Mariam first tried selling condiments, and then shoes and fabrics, but without success. Because of this, she decided to learn from her aunt how to sell cereals. She now conducts her business with more than ten years experience and is highly sought after. She makes her sales from home and from a large market in Bougouni. 

In order to expand her business, she decided to join Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she is on her sixth loan. All of her previous loans have been correctly repaid. With this loan, she will buy 1 ton of corn, 1 ton of pearl millet, and a half ton of rice. She procures her goods in Bougouni and in the surrounding villages. 

With this loan, she hopes to earn an average monthly income of 70,000 francs CFA, which will allow her to support her needs while also helping her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Lang is requesting a new loan to buy clothes for selling. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, processing capacity and sales. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and increase her income, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more clothes from different suppliers to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue, 38, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been running a soft drink stall for eight years. They sell sugarcane juice and beverages. Hue is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying different products such as soft drinks, coffee, sugars and milks to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy different products such as soft drinks, coffee, sugars and milks to better satisfy her customers

loans.name: Angel  Julio

texts.es:
Angel tiene 74 años de edad es casado vive con su esposa en el Cantón Chimbo  Provincia Bolívar.
Angel   es empleado público.

Solicita el crédito   Para la compra de una lavadora.  Las compras lo realizan  en la ciudad de Guaranda.   


Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida.  El desafío  que enfrenta es luchar contra cualquier problema. 


En el tiempo libre le gusta reunirse con la familia.
texts.en:
Angel is 74 years old, married, and lives with his wife in the canton of Chimbo, which is in Bolívar Province. He is a public employee.

Angel is requesting a loan so that he can buy a washing machine. This purchase will be made in the city of Guaranda. His dream is to improve his quality of life. The challenge he faces is striving to resolve any problem he confronts.

In his free time, Angel enjoys getting together with his family.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yacouba est un célibataire de 35 ans sans enfant qui vit chez son père dans le quartier Dialanico de Bougouni.
Après ses études secondaires sanctionnées par un diplôme en comptabilité, Yacouba est resté pendant des années sans emploi. C’est ainsi qu’après une longue réflexion il décide de suivre son grand frère pour apprendre le commerce notamment l’achat et la vente de pièces détachées et d’articles de quincaillerie. Avec 10 années d’expérience, il maîtrise son activité. Ayant fait la connaissance de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso à travers  un ami il décide lui aussi de rejoindre l’institution pour avoir un prêt afin d’acheter, 5 trousseaux de clés de toutes catégories, des cartons de pinces, de marteaux,  de tourne-vice, des rouleaux de câble et des interrupteurs auprès des grossistes de Bamako. Il effectue ses ventes au détail, au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée de toutes les catégories sociales.
Il est à son premier prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso. Les bénéfices mensuel de 80.000 FCFA qu’il espère gagner chaque mois va lui permettre d’agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Yacouba is a single 35-year-old man without children, who lives with this father in the Dialanico neighborhood of Bougouni. After finishing secondary school with a diploma in accounting, Yacouba stayed unemployed for some years. Because of this and after long reflection, he decided to learn from his older brother how to buy and sell spare parts and hardware. He has been in this business now for 10 years. 

Having learned about the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso from a friend, he decided to also join and take out a loan to buy 5 different key rings, some boxes of pliers, some hammers, some screwdrivers, some reels of cable and some switches from the wholesalers in Bamako. 

He makes his sales in cash and often in credit to customers from all walks of life. 

This is his first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. The average monthly income of 80,000 francs CFA that he hopes to earn each month will allow him to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy hardware products

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh is 38 years old, and is married. Her husband is a electrician. Linh has been running a business of selling electrical items in front of her door for seven years. She started this business to cover her expenses, and raise her four children. They live with her and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Linh is requesting a loan to expand her business by offering many kinds of electrical items so that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods so that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business

loans.name: Dao

texts.en:
Dao is a 48-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a truck driver. For five years, she has run a business of selling fast food for people in her community.

Dao would like a loan to purchase better quality food at competitive prices from wholesalers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase better quality food at competitive prices from wholesalers

loans.name: Diep

texts.en: Diep, 41, is married and has one son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a truck driver. Diep started a beauty shop five years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying hair tools and materials to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy hair tools and materials to better satisfy her customers

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El grupo Maria Auxiliadora se formó con la unión de amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Ybycui, y gracias al esfuerzo que todas están haciendo ya se encuentran en el sexto ciclo, donde todas trabajan en forma conjunta, para sobrellevar cualquier desafío.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Agueda quien se dedica a la venta de verduras, tiene un pequeño puesto bien surtido, donde día a día desde muy tempranas horas ofrece a sus clientes toda variedad de verduras frescas. Ella tiene como meta la de poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para no tener que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones.
Agueda solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras frescas para la venta, como ser cebollas, tomates, locotes, y demás tipos, para así seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Maria Auxiliadora" group is made up of friends and neighbours in the city of Ybycuí and, thanks to the effort that all the women are putting in, the group is now on its sixth loan cycle.  They all work together to beat any challenge they come across.

One of the group's members is Agueda, who makes a living selling vegetables.  She has a small but well-stocked stall where every day, from early in the morning, she sells a variety of fresh vegetables to her customers.  Agueda's aim is to continue with this work so that she can provide her family with what they need, so that they do not go without.

Agueda is applying for this loan to invest in buying fresh vegetables to sell. These vegetables include onions, tomatoes, peppers and more and will allow Agueda to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as onions, tomatoes, peppers and more to sell.

loans.name: Chau

texts.en:
Chau is 36 years old and is married with one son. She lives with her husband and son in Ho Chi Minh City. She has run a business of selling sanitary papers, tissues and plastic food boxes at her house for over 14 years. She intends to use her loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of products for selling.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her son's education.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of sanitary papers, tissues and plastic food boxes

loans.name: Chuc

texts.en: Chuc is 42 years old and is married with a son and a daughter. Her husband is a driver for hire. Chuc has been running a general store in front of her home for 20 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Chuc is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store

loans.name: Castora

texts.en: Castora is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Bohol, Philippines. Castora is a vegetable farmer and has been in the business for more than 10 years together with her husband. Castora is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to grow healthy vegetables thus allowing her to harvest and sell more to the market. In the future, Castora hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a vegetable farming business for almost five years now. This is the source of her income. Grace works hard to support her husband in their farm.
Grace is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. With this, she will be able to grow and produce a better quality of vegetables which she can then sell to the market for a good price. She dreams of improving their way of living and experiencing fullness of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Al-Ymama Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Ymama which consists of three ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB. Haya is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She started a small business of selling sheep and goats eight years ago. She found it difficult to accumulate a large amount of money to expand her business because most of the profit she makes goes to her family expenses including school fees, clothes and food. Therefore, she decided to apply for a loan of 50,000 YER to buy livestock to use in her business. She looks forward to opening a retail shop which in turn will result in her improving her income and increasing her income above the poverty line.

loans.use: to buy livestock to use in her business.

loans.name: Guido Eduardo

texts.es:
Guido tiene 58 años de edad  es casado  vive con su esposa y su hijo en Chillanes Provincia Bolívar  Comunidad   Tiguindala.
Guido se dedica a la agricultura  a la siembra de maíz y frejol. 

 Solicita el crédito para la compra de los insumos y para dar mantenimiento especifico a sus siembras.

Sus ventas lo realiza en Chillanes semanal mente. El sueño es mejorar su vivienda. 

El desafío que se enfrenta  el mal tiempo. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta estar con su familia.
texts.en: Guido is 58 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and their son in Chillanes in the Bolivar province in the community of Tiguindala. Guido is dedicated to farming and to sowing maize and  beans. He is requesting the loan to buy inputs and to provide specific maintenance to his crops. His dream is to improve his house. The challenge that he faces is bad weather. In his free time, he likes to be with his family.

loans.use: to purchase inputs and to provide specific maintenance to his crops.

loans.name: Al-Amany Group

texts.en:
Al-Amany is a group which consists of three women from Aden, Yemen. They asked for a 180,000 YER loan from AMB to help them improve their business. 
Samira is a 23-year-old mother of two children. She didn’t complete her education because she got married when she was 18. Her oldest child is three years old and the youngest is just seven months old. She started up her business three years ago. She goes door to door to sell some products like electrical goods especially in her neighborhood. She is making modest profits. She got a loan of 60,000 YER to expand her business. She wants to buy new electrical goods and start selling them to her clients not just in her neighborhood but also in near quarters. She looks forward to opening her own retail store.

loans.use: to buy new electrical goods for expanding her business.

loans.name: Yoert's Group

texts.en:
Yoert, aged 46, living in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district, Battambang province and she is single. She has been growing rice in the area to make a living. She has been in this business for several years. She can earn about 16,000 KHR per day but she can manage to save about 2,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 
Yoert has been with VisionFund for six cycles and completely repaid the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Muriet

texts.en: Muriet operates a clothes selling business and also does farming. She plans to buy a tank for water storage purposes for her family. The project will benefit six people and it will take two weeks to complete. The community faces the challenge of a lack of water. She is honest and humble and hopes to have enough water for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy a tank for  water storage purposes

loans.name: Luis Baltazar Humberto

texts.es:
Luis tiene 72 años de edad es casado vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en Chillanes  Provincia de Bolívar en la comunidad de Santa Rosa de Cerrito

Luis es integrado a la ventanilla VRC de San Isidro se encuentra formado en la comunidad de Santa Rosa de Cerritos, es una distancia de 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, son personas que se dedican a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales

Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de frejol, maíz, mora, y a la crianza de los animales como ganado. 

Solicita el crédito para la  siembra de frejol y para la compra de semilla, abonos, que es necesario para su agricultura. 

 La compra lo realiza en la ciudad de Chillanes. 

El sueño es tener salud para seguir viviendo y tener buena producción. 

Los desafíos  que se enfrenta es las enfermedades que no permiten trabajar. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta salir al pueblo a pasear y visitar a los hijos y salir a las fiestas de la comunidad
texts.en:
Luis is 72 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and their four children in Chillanes, in the province of Bolivar in the community of Santa Rosa de Cerrito.

Luis is a member of the lending group VRC of San Isidro which was formed in the community of Santa Rosa de Cerritos. It is 40 minutes away from the cooperative's offices. They are people who are dedicated to farming and to raising animals.

Luis is dedicated to farming, planting beans, maize and blackberries, as well as to raising animals like cattle. He is requesting the loan to plant beans and to buy seed and fertilizer, which is necessary for his farming. He will make the purchases in the city of Chillanes.

His dream is to have health to keep living and to have good production. The challenges that he faces are illnesses that do not allow him to work. In his free time, he likes to go out into town to walk around and to visit his children and to go to the community celebrations.

loans.use: to plant beans and to buy seed and fertilizer that is necessary for his farming.

loans.name: Rosario Umbelina

texts.es:
Rosario tiene 53 años de edad  es casada vive con sus dos  hijos en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar  comunidad Santa Rosa de Cerrito.
 
Rosario es integrante de la ventanilla VRC de San Isidro se encuentra formada en la comunidad de Santa Rosa de Cerrito de una distancia de 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa son personas  que se dedican a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales.

 Rosario se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de frejol y maíz y a la crianza de animales como el ganado. 

Solicita el crédito para la siembra de frejol y para la comprar lo que hace necesario para  agricultura como los abonos , semillas, urea, fertilizantes.

 La compra lo realiza en la ciudad de Chillanes.

 El sueño es tener una buena producción.

 Los desafíos que se enfrenta es la falta de capital para trabajar. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta salir al pueblo a pasear  y a las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Rosario is 53 years old. She is married and lives with her two children in Chillanes in the province of Bolivar in the community of Santa Rosa de Cerrito. Rosario is a member of the VRC de San Isidro lending group which was formed in the community of Santa Rosa de Cerrito, which is 40 minutes away from the cooperative's offices. They are people who are dedicated to farming and to raising animals.

Rosario is dedicated to farming, planting beans and maize and to raising animals like cattle. She is requesting the loan to plant beans and to buy what she needs for farming such as organic fertilizers, seeds, urea and chemical fertilizers.

She will make purchases in the city of Chillanes. Her dream is to have good production. The challenges she faces are the lack of capital to work. In her free time, she likes to go out for walks and going to community celebrations.

loans.use: to plant beans and to buy what she needs for farming such as organic fertilizers, seeds, urea, and chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Edilma Moraima

texts.es:
Edilma tiene 29 años de edad es madre soltera vive con sus padres y su hijo  en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar  comunidad Santa Rosa de Cerritos.

Edilma  es integrante en la ventanilla VRC de San Isidro se encuentra formada en la comunidad de Santa Rosa de Cerritos de una distancia de 40 minutos  de la oficina de la cooperativa son personas que se dedican a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales.

Edilma  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de frejol y de maíz y a la crianza de animales como el ganado. 

Solicita el crédito para la siembra de frejol y para comprar lo que es necesario para la agricultura como la semilla y el abono. 

 La compra lo realiza en la ciudad de Chillanes.

 El sueño es comprar terreno para sembrar un poco más.  

Los desafíos que se enfrenta es precios bajos de los productos en los mercados.

 En el tiempo libre le gusta salir al pueblo a pasear  y las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Edilma is 29 years old.  She is a single mother and lives with her parents and son in Chillanes, Bolívar province, in the Santa Rosa de Cerritos community.

Edilma is a member of the San Isidro communal bank in the Santa Rosa de Cerritos community.  This communal bank is some forty minutes away from the cooperative's office and its members work in agriculture and raising animals.

Edilma makes a living in agriculture - she grows beans and corn and raises animal, including cattle.

She is applying for a loan for her bean crops and to buy necessary items for her work, such as seeds and manure.

She will make her purchases in the city of Chillanes.

Her dream is to buy land to sow more crops on.

The challenge Edilma faces at the moment is the low prices that products command at the market.

In her free time, Edilma likes to go into town to have a look around and she also likes attending community events.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the crops, seeds and food for the cattle.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique tiene 41 años de edad es casado vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en Chillanes  Provincia de Bolívar Comunidad en Santa Rosa de Cerritos.

Enrique es integrante en la ventanilla  VRC de San Isidro se encuentra formado en la comunidad de Santa Rosa de Cerritos de una distancia de 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa son personas que se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Enrique se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de frejol y maíz y a la crianza de animales como ganado. 

Solicita el crédito para  la  siembra de frejol  y para la compra de los insumos que es necesario para la agricultura como abonos, semillas. 

 La compra lo realiza en la ciudad de Chillanes.

 El sueño es tener una casa con comodidades y terrenos para poder sembrar. 

Los desafíos que se enfrenta son presencias de riesgos y enfermedades en los cultivos. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta deporte como el bolí, indor y salir a la fiesta de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Enrique is forty-one years old, married and lives with his wife and four children in Chillanes, Bolívar Province, in a community called Santa Rosa de Cerritos. Enrique is a member of communal bank VRC de San Isidro, located in Santa Rosa de Cerritos, 40 minutes away from the cooperative’s office.

Its members work in agriculture and raise livestock. Enrique grows beans and corn and has cattle. He is requesting a loan to sow beans and to buy supplies needed for this activity, such as compost and seeds. He will buy the supplies in the city of Chillanes.

Enrique’s dream is to have a comfortable house and land to grow vegetables. The challenge he faces is the risk of diseases in his crops. During his free time, he likes to play volleyball, indoor football and to party together with the community.

loans.use: to sow beans and to buy supplies like compost and seeds.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of ten children, from Bohol, Philippines. Letecia has engaged in vegetable farming for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income. Letecia works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially the schooling of her children. Letecia is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. Letecia dreams of having a successful business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for vegetable farming.

loans.name: Holger Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 38 años de edad es casado vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar comunidad de Santa Rosa de Cerritos.

Francisco es integrante en la Ventanilla VRC  de San Isidro se encuentra formado en la comunidad de Santa Rosa de Cerritos de una distancia de 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa son personas que se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de los animales.

Francisco se dedica a la agricultura como la siembra de frejol y de  maíz y a la crianza de los animales como el ganado. Solicita el crédito para la compra de ganados. 

  La compra lo realiza en la ciudad de Chillanes.

 El sueño es mejora  de producción. 

Los desafíos que se enfrenta  es al mal tiempo  y la presencia de mucha lluvia.

 En el tiempo libre le gusta deporte como el boly y  las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Francisco, who is 38, is married and lives with his wife and four children in the commune of Santa Rosa de Cerritos which lies in Chillanes canton in Bolívar province.  

Francisco is a member of the VRC de San Isidro solidarity group which was set up in Santa Rosa de Cerritos, which is some 40 minutes away from the cooperative's office.  The group's members are people who work in agriculture and livestock rearing.  

Francisco's agricultural work involves sowing beans and corn and rearing animals such as livestock.  He is applying for this loan to buy livestock in Chilanes City.  

His ambition is to boost his production.  In his work, he has to face the twin challenges of bad weather and high rainfall.  

In his free time he likes sports such as volleyball and local festivals.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Fausto Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 59 años de edad es casado vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar comunidad Santa Rosa de Cerritos.

Manuel es integrante en la ventanilla VRC de San Isidro se encuentra formado en la comunidad de Santa Rosa de Cerritos de una distancia de 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa son personas que se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de los animales.

Manuel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de frejol y de maíz y a la crianza de animales como el ganado. 

Solicita el crédito para la compra de ganado y terrenos.

  La compra lo realiza en Chillanes. 

El sueño es mejora de producción tener salud para seguir viviendo.

 Los desafíos que se enfrenta es precios bajos en el mercado de los productos que produce. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear y visitar a los familiares y salir a las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Manuel, who is 59, is married and lives with his wife and three children in the commune of Santa Rosa de Cerritos which lies in Chillanes in Bolívar province. 
 
Manuel is a member of the VRC de San Isidro solidarity group which was set up in Santa Rosa de Cerritos, which is some 40 minutes away from the cooperative's office.  The group's members are people who work in agriculture and livestock rearing.  

Manuel's agricultural work involves sowing beans and corn and rearing animals such as livestock.  He is applying for this loan to buy livestock and plots of land and will make his purchases in Chillanes. 

His ambition is to boost his production and to keep healthy so as to have a long life.  

In his work, he has to face the problem of low prices in the market for the produce which he produces.

In his free time, he likes to go out for walks, visit members of his family and take part in the local festivals.

loans.use: to buy livestock and plots of land.

loans.name: Roum's Group

texts.en:
Living a wooden house in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Roum is 55 years old and married with five children. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming and cassava planting. Roum have been in this business for many years. With the current business, she can earn about 33,000 KHR per day.
This is the seventh loan for Roum with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund and she has completely paid back the previous loans. She successfully used the past loans to improve her livelihood. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. Roum is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seed for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield and sell it for a good price, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seed for her farmland.

loans.name: Edwin Saul

texts.es: Edwin de 38 años de edad, es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maiz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad comercializa en los diferentes mercados que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia. Edwin solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga y fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Edwin, who is 38, lives with his wife and three children and is a very friendly and hard-working man.  He works tremendously hard on his own plot of land where he grows corn and beans.  His produce is of very high quality and he sells it in a number of markets close to where he lives.  Edwin is applying for a loan from INTEGRAL to buy agricultural supplies, such as pesticides and fertiliser, manure and seeds, amongst other things, which he needs for his planting.  He is keen to boost his sales, which will enable him to earn more and provide greater financial stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as: manure, seeds, fertiliser etc.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao lives in a rural village in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 46 years old and married with five children. To support her family, she has been working as a farmer who grows rice and corn. Having been in this business for 20 years, she can earn about 46,000 KHR per day to make a living and afford to save 11,000 KHR each day after expenses.
Mao has been with VisionFund for seven cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped to relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, Mao is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow more healthy rice and corn to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Rosa Candida

texts.es:
Rosa, posee una mini tienda y pupuseria  como una fuente de ingresos para mejorar la economía. Ella vive con su esposo, sus tres hijos; esta actividad la realiza en los horarios de 6:00 am a 8:00 pm y lo hace desde que estaba pequeña de edad.
El crédito que requiere le permitirá comprar dos estantes y granos básicos tales como: frijol, aceite, arroz, maíz, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a surtir el negocio para satisfacer aun más las necesidades de sus clientes. 
Su objetivo es ampliar la tienda con mayor mercadería para poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa has a small shop and also sells stuffed tortillas in order to earn money to improve her finances.  Rosa lives with her husband and three children and works from 6am until 8pm.  She has been doing this since she was a young girl.

Rosa needs a loan to buy two stands and basic items such as beans, oil, rice, corn and more.  This investment will help her to stock up her business to satisfy her customers' needs.

Rosa's aim to fill the shop with more merchandise so as to provide her customers with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy two stands and basic items such as beans, oil, rice and corn.

loans.name: Rhulangani Group

texts.fr: La cliente Chantal est présidente  du collectif d’affaire  Rhulangani, entrepreneur,  âgée de 43  ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’administration publique. La cliente est vendeuse de farines de maïs et de manioc. Elle commença cette affaire avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia des fonds additionnels de crédit de l’IMF Hekima.  Il ya 11 ans révolus, elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter  4 sacs de semoules au Rwanda.  La problématique de transport est un défis majeur pour son activité.  Elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants et accroitre son capital. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit.
texts.en: Chantal is the president of Rhulangani Group.  She is an entrepreneur, 43-years old, married, and mother of seven children.  Her spouse is a government employee. Chantal is a seller of corn and manioc flour.  She started her business with her own funds that she she received from her husband.  Later, she received additional funds via an IMF Hakima loan.  She has been in business for 11 years.  This new loan will enable her to buy four bags of semolina in Rwanda.  The problem of transportation is a major challenge for her business.  She wants her children to attend school and to increase her capital.  Lastly, she thanks Hekima for their support via microcredit.

loans.use: to buy four bags of semolina

loans.name: Jose Manfredis

texts.es:
José, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol. Él vive con un familiar y el cultivo lo realiza para obtener los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante cubriendo los gastos de la casa, el trabajo lo lleva a cabo de lunes a sábado de 6:00 am a 12:00 pm, este oficio lo aprendió con sus padres desde muy pequeño. 
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, semilla de frijol para luego sembrarlo. Este le ayudara a aumentar la capacidad de inversión y los ingresos.
Su sueño es mejorar económicamente pata tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José works growing corn and beans. He lives with a family member and grows his crops to get the income he needs to get ahead, covering the household expenses. He works Monday through Saturday from 6:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. He learned this trade from his parents when he was very young.
 
This loan that he needs will allow him to buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, pesticide and bean seeds to plant. This will help him to increase his investment capacity and his income. His dream is to improve financially to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, pesticide, and bean seeds to plant.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio y así obtener mayores ingresos. Este le permitirá comprar cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a crecer más en la actividad que desempeña y tener todo lo necesario para llevarlo a cabo. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares asimismo, ya que tiene mejores ingresos.
texts.en: María is asking for a new loan because she needs to invest more in her business and thus have better income. It will allow her to buy pigs to fatten and then sell. The previous loan helped her grow more in her activity and have everything necessary to do it. Her financial conditions have improved as well as her family circumstances, since she has better income.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten and then sell.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Muminjon

texts.ru: Муминчон первые кредитуется в ИМОН. Муминчон женат, и на воспитании имеет 5 несовершеннолетних детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Его родители и братья живут вместе с ним в его доме. Он добросовестный, честный, целеустремленный и трудолюбивый человек. Он родился в сельской местности, который имеет хорошие условие для животноводства и выращивание сельхоз культуры. Он имеет достаточный опыт по скотоводству и выращивания сельхоз культуры. Он данное время является трактористом и имеет собственный трактор ЮМЗ-6Л год выпуска 1985 год. Этот трактор является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Он хочет отремонтировать свой старый дом, но не имеет денег для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, краски и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muminchon is applying for a loan at IMON for the first time. He is married and is raising 5 teenagers. His wife is a homemaker. His parents and brother with him and his family. He is a conscientious, honest, determined, and hardworking person. He was born in a rural area which is well-suited for animal husbandry and farming. He is experienced in both of these areas. Currently he works as tractor operator and has his own 1985 YUMZ-BL tractor. The tractor is his family's only source of income. He wants to repair his old house, but does not have enough money for this. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 US dollars to buy building materials, such as cement, lumber, paint, etc. He awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy building materials as cement, wood, and paint for repairing his house

loans.name: Sobir

texts.ru:
Собиру 49 лет. Он женатый человек. Собир проживает в районе Спитамен, города Худжанд. Он живет с женой и детьми. У него трое детей, две дочери и сын. Жена Собира домохозяйка. Сам Собир занимается растениеводством. Этим видом деятельности он занимается с малых лет. У него имеется большой опыт, с детства Собир помогал своим родителям с посевом сельскохозяйственных культур.   
Собир берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы начать свой бизнес. Он намерен закупить 2 голов коров, теленка и корма для скота. Собир планирует в течении 60 дней разводить скот, а потом реализовать на скотном рынке района, который находится недалеко от дома клиента. В этом бизнесе ему будет помогать жена и старшая дочь.
