texts.en: Sobir is 49 and married. He lives in the city of Khundjand, in the Spitamen district of Tajikistan. He lives with his wife and children. They have three children: two daughters and one son. Sobir's wife is a homemaker. Sobir himself is a farmer; he has been involved in farming since he was a young boy. He has a lot of experience; when he was young, he used to help his parents plant crops. Sobir is requesting a loan to buy cattle in order to start his own business. He plans to buy two cows, a calf, and feed. He is going to keep them for two months, and then sell them at the district's livestock market, which is located nearby. Both his wife and oldest daughter are going to help him operate the new business.

loans.use: to buy two cows, and calf, and cattle feed

loans.name: Al-Kfah Group

texts.en:
Al-Kfah Group consists of four women from Hadramout, Yemen. Each member has her own business. They are requesting a group loan for 280,000 YER and they hold each other accountable for repayment.

Muna is 46 years old, widowed, and has one child. She is works hard to cover living expenses and rent. She is a seamstress who is a professional in her field. She would like to buy for her business so she is requesting a loan from AMB for 80,000 YER, which she will use to buy a sewing machine to keep her business running and expand it. She looks forward to making a large profits and accumulating money to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elías, se dedica a la agricultura, este oficio lo realiza a raíz de la necesidad de obtener ingresos para aportar a su familia para los gastos del hogar y cualquier otra necesidad, el trabajo del cultivo de granos básicos lo realiza de 5:00 am a 4:00 pm. Elías, está casado y tiene tres hijos de edades de 8, 12, 16; no recibe ayuda del extranjero.
El crédito que requiere le ayudara para comprar abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas y semilla para llevar a cabo el cultivo; este le permitirá  tener una mejor cosecha, asimismo incrementar la productividad y las ganancias.
Su objetivo es mejor la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Elías makes a living in agriculture.  He began this work because of the necessity to earn income in order to support his family and to help with home expenses and with any other need.  He does this work of growing basic grains from 5:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. 

Elías is married and has three children, ages 8, 12, and 16.  He does not receive help from family living abroad.

The loan that he requires will help him to buy fertilizer, herbicide, pest-control substances, insecticide, and seeds to carry out his farming.  This will allow him to have a better harvest, thereby increasing his productivity and profits.

His goal is to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, pest-control substances, insecticide, and seeds to carry out his farming.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
In the business of mobile money transfers, Allan used his previous loan to buy a new booth for his second shop. The shop is doing very well, and Allan is happy with the number of transactions that he does on a day-to-day basis. In addition, Allan was able to expand his products and increase his profits by adding mobile airtime top ups. He says he values the loan he obtained as it has also improved his life. He is now engaged to get married in November of this year.

Allan is requesting a new loan because he was evicted from his business premises by his landlord. Allan was served with an eviction letter because someone else was eyeing the same property and offered the landlord twice what Allan was paying for the shop.  He is taking out the loan so that he can buy a trading booth and move his business to another location where he will pay the local government directly for the space.

loans.use: To purchase a trading booth and pay for a new location.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a 35-year-old, married woman and the mother of two children. She and her family are from Garcia-Hernandez, Bohol. 

Rosie earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business where she sells various goods and commodities to the people nearby. Rosie is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell such as canned goods, rice, soap and detergents. 

With this loan, Rosie will be able to attract more buyers to her store, thus enabling her to sell more and earn more. In the future, Rosie hopes to expand her business and make it successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell such as canned goods, rice, soap and detergents.

loans.name: Humberto Mario

texts.es:
Humberto, decide optar por un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de más capital de trabajo y por la ventaja que favorece estos financiamientos; este le permitirá comprar ganado para engordarlos y luego venderlos. 
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar los ingresos, crecer en el negocio y tener a la mano todo lo necesario para llevar a cabo la actividad que realiza; las circunstancias familiares han mejorado, asimismo las condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Humberto has decided to opt for a new loan because of his need for more working capital and because of the advantage that this financing offers him.  This loan will let him buy livestock, which he will then fatten and sell.

His previous loan helped him to increase his revenue, to grow his business, and to have everything he needed for his business at hand.  His family's circumstances have improved, as have their economic conditions.

loans.use: to buy livestock that he will then fatten and sell.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha de 38 años de edad , es soltera y con una vivienda propia hecha a base de adobe donde comparte sus vivencias familiares junto a sus 2 hijos .Durante años se desempeño en labores agrícolas tales como la producción de cacao orgánico y otros propios de la zona.Con el paso de los años y algo agotada por la constante labor en el campo optó por poner sus parcelas en alquiler y posteriormente invertir el capital que acumuló hasta entonces en la apertura de una tienda de abarrotes.Al contar con poco dinero adquirió poca mercadería logrando ampliarlo de a pocos con la venta de arroz, azúcar, cereales, verduras, conservas y otros.
Hace poco vio necesario pausar sus labores cotidianas puesto que cayo enferma ocasionándole algunas pérdidas económicas pero al ser una madre muy trabajadora desea abrir nuevamente su negocio.Tiene como objetivo a largo plazo construir su vivienda a base de material noble esperando mejorar su calidad de vida .Este es su primer crédito con Kiva , se muestra muy agradecida por la oportunidad financiera brindada .Con el monto solicitado de 3,000 nuevos soles comprará mercadería para reiniciar su negocio tales como sacos de arroz, azúcar, conservas, verduras, fideos, golosinas, gaseosas y demás productos buena demanda entre su clientela.
texts.en:
Bertha, 38 years old, is single and lives with her two children in her own home made out of adobe. She worked for many years in agriculture including the production of organic chocolate and other crops native to her region. Over the years she became tired of constantly working the fields, and she decided to rent her land and invest the capital that she earned in the opening of a small corner store. Since she had little money, she acquired minimal merchandise at the start, and has been able to grow her offerings through the sale of rice, sugar, cereals, vegetables and other products. 

A short while ago she had to pause her work in the store when she fell sick, and she suffered some economic losses during this time. However, being a mother and a very hardworking women, she would now like to open the store again. Her long term goal is to construct a new home with better materials, in order to improve her quality of life. This is her first loan with Kiva, and she is very grateful for the opportunity it provides. With the amount she is asking for, she will be able to buy merchandise to re-start her business, including rice, sugar, vegetables, noodles, sweets, sodas, and other products that her clients demand.

loans.use: to buy products including rice, sugar, and noodles among others

loans.name: Tochikul

texts.ru: Точикул добросовестный, целеустремлённый и трудолюбивый человек. Он родился в сельской местности, который имеет хорошее условие для животноводства и выращивания сельскохозяйственных культур. Семья Точикула была  малообеспеченной, и он с детства помогал родителям по скотоводству и выращивания сельхоз культуры. Сам Точикул перенес много трудности жизни, так как жил в малообеспеченной семье. После окончания средней школы Точикул женился, и его жена помогала ему по животноводству и выращиванием сельхоз культур. В основном они занимались скотоводством, то есть из базара покупали скот по низкой цене, на определённое время откармливали  и перепродали по высокой цене. В этом году их бизнес не дал положительных результатов, Поэтому старший сын уехал на заработки Федерацию России. До этого семья Точикула проживали только на доходы от животноводства. Кроме того Точикулу надо отремонтировать дом и готовиться к свадьбу сына. Поэтому Точикул обращался  в нашу организацию с целью получения займа для покупки строительных материалов.  Точикул надеется на Вашу благотворительность и милосердие.
texts.en: Tochikul is a conscientious, determined, and hardworking person. He was born in a rural area, which is good for animal husbandry and farming. Tochikul comes from a poor family, and he helped his parents raise livestock and farm when he was a small boy. Coming from a poor family, he has gone through many difficult times. After graduating from high school, he got married, and his wife helped him raise livestock and grow crops. He mainly worked at raising livestock; that is, he would buy cattle at a low price, fatten them for a certain amount of time, and then resell them for a good price. This year their business has not been successful, which caused their oldest son to go abroad and work in Russia. Prior to this, Tochikul's family was completely dependent on the income from animal husbandry. In addition, Tochikul needs to repair his house and prepare for his son's wedding. Therefore, Tochikul has turned to IMON to obtain a loan to buy building materials. Tochikul is counting on your compassion and generosity.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing his house

loans.name: Rath

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Moung Russey district, Rath is 35 years old and married. She has four children, three of whom are in school. She is a rice farmer and also supplements that income by growing pineapple in her local area. Having been in this business for five years, she currently can earn about 27,000 KHR per day. 

Rath is just with VisionFund in this cycle. She is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to sell it for a good price to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Sibusiso

texts.en:
Sibusiso is a student at the Maharishi Institute in Johannesburg. He is applying for a loan to pay for his last semester of tuition fees and living expenses. Sibusiso is 31 years old. H was asked the following questions by a member of the Institute:

What do you plan to do after graduation?
“My dream is to be the best marketing executive in the world. My hope is to be able to pass what I have learnt to other people, because it is important to me that I share what I have learnt at Maharishi.”

List 3 long-term goals:
"1. Have my own marketing school.
2. Work with various organizations that will help liberate the youth of Africa as a whole.
3. Educate the youth of Africa."

Why is education important to you?
“Education is important to me because it helps in different ways. The biggest part of education is the youth -- to liberate the minds and free them from the chains. And now it helps us to achieve the economic freedom that we need as Africans.”

Why are you applying for the Kiva loan?
“It will help me achieve my goals without having to worry about my financial situation and focus on my studies. Finances are the benefit for me, so the Kiva loan will help me to achieve goals. Then I will be able to give back to my community, my country and my continent. It's important to pass it to my continent at large.”

What are you hobbies?
“Playing soccer, going out with friends, creating networks. Most of the time I love reading leadership books to broaden my thinking.”

Where are you from?
“I’m from Soweto, born and raised there. I’m the fourth born of a family of six children. I have four sisters and a brother. My family is not privileged but is not doing bad at all. My father believes in education but I could not further my studies because he lost his job. Since then I made sure that I attend to achieve my dreams.”

Are you the first family member to attend University? Do you have any other siblings in school?
“Yes I am the first in my family and no one else has gone to tertiary due to financial constraint. There is only one who is doing grade 4. The others are currently employed in different organizations."

loans.use: to pay for one semester of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one semester of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Kim is 63 years old and married with six children. The main sources of his family’s income are rice farming and cow raising. Kim has been in this business for ten years. With the current business, he can earn about 29,000 KHR per day. 

This is the fourth loan for Kim with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and he completely paid back the prior loans. He successfully used the past loan to improve his livelihood. Now he is applying for another loan of 4,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and seeds for his cultivated land and use a portion of it on labor fees. He hopes to increase his crop yield and sell it for a good price so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for his cultivated land

loans.name: Mpilo

texts.en:
Mpilo is a student on the Maharishi Institute in Johannesburg. He is applying for a loan to pay for his last semester of tuition fees and living expenses. Mpilo is 27 years old and was asked the following questions by a member of the Institute:

What do you plan to do after graduation?
“To be an 'intrepreneur' and, after getting experience, then an entrepreneur. The most important thing is to develop poor communities and create jobs. (Most people from home are unemployed because of lack of education and money to proceed with schooling).”

List 3 long-term goals:
“Have a complex or mall in my home town and my own business. Help people who need help. Develop rural communities.”

Why is education important to you?
“To have a better tomorrow and see life in a different perspective. The most important thing about education is for me to pass it through to others who need it.”

Why are you applying for the Kiva Loan?
“So that I can have enough money for transport to get to school and work daily, especially be punctual.

What are you hobbies?
“Playing chess, Scrabble, watching movies and table tennis.”

Where are you from?
“From Bushbuckridge (Mpumulanga) and I come from a family of four. My background is not that bad.”

Are you the first family member to attend University? Do you have any other siblings in school?
“No. No, she is working”

loans.use: to pay for one semester of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Juan Obdulio

texts.es: juan de 39 años de edad, es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 15 años. El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela en la que actualmente ha sembrado maíz y maicillo, con las ganancias que obtiene logra sacar adelante a su familia, juan solicita un préstamo para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga y fertilizantes como muestra la fotgrafia para tener mejores cultivos entre otras cosas necesarias para las cosechas, ya que ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder resivir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en: Juan is 39 years old, very friendly and hardworking, and he lives with his wife and 15 year old son. He works very hard on his own piece of land and he is currently cultivating corn. With the earnings that he obtains from this work he has been able to support his family. Juan is asking for a loan in order to have the money necessary to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies such as pesticides and fertilizer (he can be seen with his fertilizing tools in the photo). This will allow him to have better harvests, and by increasing his sales will improve his earnings and his ability to provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Bethel Lom Group

texts.en:
Kimlhing is the featured borrower of Bethel Lom and she is pictured with her hand raised. She is blessed with five healthy boys and her husband serves as a teacher in a government school. All the boys are still in school and she usually manages the household chores on her own. She also laughs out loud saying, “Raising five boys is a total menace!"

She is also raising pigs besides managing the boys and the chores. Piggery is the only option left for Kimlhing to generate an income for the family because she needs to stay at home for the children. She also made a good profit recently after she sold the fully grown pigs. She was able to pay back the loan and also used a portion of her income for her children’s education. 

She says that so far she has not faced any difficulty in raising pigs and finds it easy because the bigger boys are also helping her in feeding the pigs when they have holidays or vacations.
 
With the Kiva Loan, she will buy three more piglets, raise them and sell them when they are fully grown. She aspires to expand her piggery in the future, make savings in the bank, and build a house. Kimlhing says that her only savings so far are with the group members and she wishes to have her own savings account in the bank. She will work really hard to be more successful in her piggery and also in bringing up her boys.

She thanks WSDS and Kiva for the financial aid and wishes both healthy and prosperous years ahead. She says “Thank you, Kiva.”

loans.use: To purchase three more piglets, raise them and sells for profits.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of three young children from Bohol, Philippines. Jenny is engaged in vegetable farming and has been in the business for more than five years now together with her husband. Jenny is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm and eventually her income. Jenny has hopes of investing in other ventures someday to further augment her income.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margret, a God-fearing and humble woman, sells clothes and is also a farmer. She plans to use this loan, her first with SMEP DTM, to buy a water tank so as to access clean water easily. The project will benefit 10 family members and it will take two weeks to complete.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Jose Rudys

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la agricultura; realiza siembra de cultivo de granos básicos para adquirir mejores entradas de dinero para ayudar a la familia, ya que este financiamiento le sera de mucha utilidad. Este le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas y semilla de maíz para sembrar. 
El crédito le ayudara a aumentar las utilidades e invertirlas  en los gastos necesarios para el hogar; su sueño es darle una mejor estabilidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: José works in agriculture, cultivating basic grains in order to acquire more money to support his family. This loan will allow him to buy fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide, insecticide, and corn seeds for planting. This loan will help him to improve his earnings and invest them in covering his home expenses. His dream is to provide greater economic stability to his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide, insecticide, and corn seeds for planting

loans.name: Madres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Madres Emprendedoras son 15 integrantes  muy responsables y trabajadoras se reúnen siempre para resolver cualquier problema del grupo ayudan asu comunidad siempre y entre ellas también todas.
Pamela, se dedica a la venta de productos de limpiezas, que obtiene por medio de las microfranquicias que le ofrece la fundación paraguaya. Gracias a su trabajo está saliendo adelante y ayuda y da a su familia todo lo que ella puede por medio de su trabajo. Ella está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de la fundación y de kiva, pues no solo ella se ve beneficiada.
Solicita este crédito para la compra de microfranquicias de limpieza, para que pueda seguir con sus ventas y teniendo de esa forma los ingresos con lo que atienda a su familia.
texts.en:
The lending group Madres Emprendadores (Entrepreneurial Mothers) has 15 very responsible and hardworking members who always meet to resolve any group problems and who always help each other and their community when needed. 

Pamela works selling cleaning products, which she obtains from micro-franchises offered by the Fundación Paraguaya. Thanks to her work she is getting ahead, and she gives her family everything she can. She is very grateful for the opportunity she is receiving from this microfinance institution and from Kiva, as not only she will benefit. She is asking for this loan in order to buy cleaning micro-franchises, so she can continue her sales and in this way improve her earnings and her ability to care for her family.

loans.use: to buy cleaning micro-franchises

loans.name: Lidiah

texts.en: Lidiah  sews clothes and also does farming and plans to use her loan to buy a water tank so as to access water for home consumption easily.  The project will benefit six family members and it will take two weeks to complete. The community faces a challenge of lack of water storage facilities. This is Lidiah's first loan with SMEP DTM. She is a hardworking and humble woman and hopes to have enough clean water for her family in future.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Sibusiso

texts.en:
Sibusiso is a student on the Maharishi Institute in Johannesburg. He is applying for a loan to pay for his last semester of tuition fees and living expenses. Sibusiso is 30 years old and was asked the following questions by a member of the Institute:

What do you plan to do after graduation?
“I hope to find a job and work for three years. After gaining some experience, it is my dream to venture into business. Entrepreneurship will allow me an opportunity to be my own boss.”

List 3 long-term goals:
"1. Gain experience  
2. Entrepreneurship  
3. Community development."

Why is education important to you?
“Business is related to education. Business plan, contract forms, etc. -- all these require one to learn and understand them. It gives you understanding so that you can make strategic plans.”

Why are you applying for the Kiva Loan?
“The Kiva loan will make it possible for me to pay for my fees.”

What are your hobbies?
“Reading, watching uplifting movies, listening to music, relaxing with friends and telling jokes.”

Where are you from?
“I was born in a small town called Newcastle in KZN. My granny used to go to school to sell; that is how we were raised. During that time my mother used to work in Joburg and she still does. They are so excited about my BBA and they hope that I will help them.”

Are you the first family member to attend University? Do you have any other siblings in school?
“Certainly I’m the first. Yes, I do have siblings who attend school in Newcastle. Since I’m the first to attend university, I am also planning not to be the last.”

loans.use: to pay for one semester of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona, a 64-year-old widowed mother of 10, lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental where she owns and operates a native roof-making enterprise to earn a living. In business for over 16 years, she earns 3,000 PHP every month.

Ramona joined GDMPC in 2009 and is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase raw materials for making native roofs. Ramona plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making native roofs.

loans.name: 5 Star Lom Group

texts.en:
“I like raising Pigs” says Hekim and she laughs. She has been raising pigs for more than ten years and she is a champ. She is the featured borrower member with the 5 Star Lom Group, and she is pictured with hand raised. 

Hekim doesn’t spend extra money for the pigs feed because her husband works as a contractual chef in the nearby army camp. The leftovers in the army mess are brought by her husband and they use them as pigs feed. She says that if she had to purchase feeds for pigs, she would spend half of her money in buying the pigs feed, which would disable her to buy more piglets. With the help of her husband, she manages to raise pigs in the easiest way.  She also manages to let her four kids get education in private schools and also rents paddy fields for ploughing since she doesn’t own one.

With the Kiva loan, she will buy five more piglets and raise them. She wants to raise as much as she can because she is not worried about the feeds. The feeds are provided free of cost from the army mess and they are enough to feed a number of pigs. Thus, she says, “The more pigs I raise, the more profit I make.”

Hekim’s future plan is to own a paddy field and a plot of land for the family. She believes in her dreams and says that her husband and she will work hard to fulfill their dreams.

She also thanks WSDS and Kiva for the support and says, “God bless Kiva.”

loans.use: To purchase five more piglets, raise them and sell for profits.

loans.name: Fermina

texts.en:
Fermina is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of ten children from Bohol, Philippines. 

She is a vegetable farmer and has been in the business for more than 20 years now, together with her husband.

Fermina is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this, she will be able to improve their farm and eventually their harvest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en:
Fuad is a 38-year-old married man who has two children, living in Sana`a, Yemen. 

He is employed in the electrician association, getting low salary. He has a financial problem that his salary isn`t enough to cover his family's expenses. He is applying for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB in order to buy furniture to use in his house. 

He is planning to open a retail store to make sure that his income is good enough to cover his expenses and his family's, too, at the same time.

loans.use: to buy furniture to use for his house.

loans.name: Alba America

texts.es: Alba de 33 años de edad vive con su hijo, es una mujer luchadora y responsable para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Actualmente trabaja vendiendo comida cerca de su lugar de residencia cerca de una zona indudustrial desde hace varios años tiene mucha clientela fija pues da a un buen precio el plato de comida, alba desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión,es por eso que solicita un crédito para comprar lo dicho; y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su hijo lo necesario sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en: Alba, 33 years old, lives with her son.  She is a determined and responsible woman so that her family doesn’t lack what is necessary for subsistence.  Currently she works selling food near her place of residence near an industrial area.  For several years she has had a lot of regular customers as she gives a good price to a plate of food.  Alba wants to expand her sales stall by buying tables, chairs and more raw materials to vary her menu and to have a bit more coming in economically but she doesn’t have sufficient income for this investment.  For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy the above-mentioned items and thus obtain better earnings to give her son everything necessary without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables and ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Moirana

texts.en:
Moirana plans to use this loan to buy a tank for water harvesting purposes. Five people will benefit from this project, and it will take two weeks to complete the project. The community faces the challenge of a lack of water storage facilities. 

Moriana operates a material selling business and also does farming. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She is honest and humble and hopes to have enough clean water for her family in future.

loans.use: to buy a tank for water harvesting purposes.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is 43 years old and married. He has four children. He is uneducated, living in a poor area in Sana`a, Yemen. 

His house is very old and in a miserable situation. He has accumulated some money to renovate his house. It is known that house renovation needs a lot of money. He has started renovating his house but now he is short of money. He needs to complete the renovation task, so he asked for a loan of 200,000 YER to buy construction supplies. He hopes that after the completion of house renovation, he starts accumulating money to improve the life conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to complete his house renovation.

loans.name: Nay's Group

texts.en:
Nay is 28 years old and married. She lives with her husband and four children in a rural area in the Bovel district of the Battambang province. She and her husband are farmers who have been growing rice and corn to make a living. Having been in this business for 10 years, together they can earn about KHR 41,000 per day. 

Nay is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, Nay is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her business and produce more crops to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is 54 years old and married with four children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is planting and harvesting vegetables for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph operates a retail shop and also keeps livestock. He plans to use his loan to buy a tank so as to easily access clean water for home purposes. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM, and the previous loan he repaid successfully. This project will benefit 20 family members and 40 neighbors, and it will take two weeks to complete. The community faces a challenge of lack of sufficient water for consumption. Joseph hopes to have a healthy family.

loans.use: to buy a tank so as to access water for home purposes.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael operates a chemist shop and also does farming as a way of earning income. She plans to use the loan for water harvesting purposes, so as to access water for consumption easily. The project will benefit six family members, and it will take two weeks to complete. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She is humble and God-fearing and hopes to have enough clean water for consumption in the future.

loans.use: to buy a tank for water harvesting purposes.

loans.name: Romnick

texts.en:
Romnick is 19 years old and single. He lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport service in the local community to earn a living. He has been in his business for one year and earns 2,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

He joined GDMPC in the year 2012, and now he has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Monico

texts.en:
Monico is 59 years old and married with six children. He lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in his business for over eight years and earns 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

He joined GDMPC in the year 2011, and now he has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase spare parts for better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for better service.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a 38-year-old married woman and the mother of eight children. She and her family live in Garcia-Hernandez, Bohol. 

Teresa has been engaged in vegetable farming for more than 19 years now. This is her main source of income. Teresa is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizers and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, she will be able to grow and harvest a good amount of vegetables and sell them at the market for a good price. 

In the future, Teresa hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizers and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Ely

texts.en:
Ely is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 34 years old and single. To make a living, Ely owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, offering transportation services. Ely has been engaged in his business for four years and earns 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month for these activities. 

In 2011, Ely joined GDMPC. Ely is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.name: Ana Victoria

texts.es:
Ana Victoría  es hija única de la Sra. Rosa del Carmen, ama de casa y el Sr. Alejandro, obrero de una empresa metalmecánica. Ana cuenta con 19 años de edad y nacida en Monterrey, México. Ella desde muy chica ha sido muy tenáz y con mucho esfuerzo de sus padres, logró terminar la Preparatoria. 

Por la situación económica de sus padres, ya no pudo continuar sus estudios y decidió iniciar un pequeño puesto de venta de accesorios para celulares, en un mercado rodante cercano a su domicilio, que solo se instalaba los fines de semana. Con un poco de dinero que consiguió como préstamo, pudo adquirir algunos accesorios e iniciar su negocio.  

Ana ya cumplió 2 años con su negocio que ha ido creciendo con mucha demanda y se siente muy entusiasmada por el crédito que ha solicitado para agregar a su negocio, la venta de accesorios computacionales, ya que constantemente los clientes le solicitan ese tipo de accesorio. Ella tiene la esperanza que con los ingresos adicionales de esta nueva etapa en su negocio, servirán para seguir ayudando a sus padres y dar continuidad a sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ana Victoría is the only daughter of Mrs. Rosa del Carmen, a housewife, and Mr. Alejandro, a worker for a metallurgical company.  Ana is 19 years old, and she was born in Monterrey, México.  Every since she was very little she has been tenacious.  With great effort from her parents she managed to complete high school.   Due to her parents’ financial situation, she is not now able to continue her education.

She decided to set up a small stand selling cell phone accessories at a flea market that is close to her home.  It was only set up on the week-ends.  With a little bit of money that she got as a loan, she was able to get some accessories and start her business.

Ana has now had her business for two years.  It has grown with much demand.  She is very enthusiastic about the loan she has requested.  She will use the loan to add the sale of computer accessories to her business.  This is because the customers are constantly requesting this type of accessory.

She hopes that with the additional income from this new stage in her business she will continue helping her parents and that she will pursue her education.

loans.use: to get merchandise.

loans.name: Adelante Cocachacra Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “Adelante Cocachacra” conformado por 06 socios entusiastas de comenzar a trabajar, la gran mayoría de ello vecinos de la zona. Geny de 41 años es separada y tiene 01 hijo. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas, bebidas y frutas, dentro de un colegio. Siendo sus clientes alumnos y maestros del mismo. Geny es una mujer emprendedora muestra de ello es que ha  mejorado su vivienda. Posteriormente piensa poner una bodega, pues así asegura ella tendrá mayores ganancias. Solicitó el crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio la cual comprará golosinas y bebidas para su kiosco. El nuevo grupo “Adelante Cocachacra” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito ya que le permite su progreso. Geny es la tercera del lado derecho, viste blusa floreada y pantalón plomo.
texts.en: This is the new “Adelante Cocachacra” group, made up of six members who are enthusiastic about starting to work.  Most of them live in the zone.  Geny is 41 years old, is separated and has a son.  She sells snacks, drinks, and fruit on the school grounds.  Her customers are students and teachers.  Geny  is an enterprising woman and this shows by the improvements she has been able to make to her home.  She wants to set up a shop because this will help her have greater earnings.  She is asking for this loan so that she can continue investing in her business and buy snacks and drinks for her kiosk.  The new “Adelante Cocachacra” group is grateful to those who made this loan possible because it helps them to move ahead.  Geny is the third person on the right, wearing a flowered blouse and grey pants.

loans.use: to buy snacks and drinks.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.fr: Josiane est une femme de 27 ans, marié et mère de 4 enfants.elle possède et gère une petite alimentation dans un quartier de la ville où elle vend des produits de première nécessité tels riz, arachide, huiles etc depuis 11 mois . vu l'accroissement de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit pour lui permettre de satisfaire cette cliente en renforçant son stock de marchandises en achetant de 15 à 20 bidons d'huiles. ces achats vont lui permettre d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires et ces profits. les bénéfices ainsi générés seront injectés dans son activité pour l’accroître d'une part et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille d'autre part
texts.en:
Josiane, age 27, is married and the mother of four children. She owns and runs a food stall in one of her town's quarters, where she's been selling food staples such as rice, peanuts, oil, ... for eleven months.

She's seeking a loan in order to be able to satisfy her growing clientele. She wants to bolster her stock by purchasing 15 to 20 cans of oil. This will enable her to increase her revenue and profits.

She will reinvest one part of the profits in her business, in order to expand it. The other part will be used to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy 15 to 20 cans of oil

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna , esta casada y vive junto a su único hijo en su vivienda construida a base de material noble .Al cumplir un buen tiempo como agricultora de cacao orgánico decidió optar por un camino más comercial y dinámico desempeñándose como compradora de productos agrícolas en su comunidad.
Lleva desempeñando este trabajo un promedio de 5 años, logrando hacerse muy conocida por los productores de su zona a quienes compra diversos productos como cacao, café, achiote, palillo y barbasco para almacenarlos en un ambiente reservado.Comenta que le agrada mucho su trabajo ya que es menos forzoso mas no algo sencillo, puesto que debe contactar con compradores mayores de la ciudad para obtener precios justos  para los productos que comercializa beneficiando así tanbien a los productores de su localidad.Próximo a iniciarse la época de cosecha de algunos productos agrícolas desea contar con capital de respaldo para llevar adelante su labor esperando recuperar su inversión en corto plazo y con ganancias adicionales.Este es su primer crédito otorgado por Kiva y se muestra muy contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad brindada para asi trabajar con mas fluidez sin descuidar el pago puntual de sus cuotas.Con los 4,000 nuevos soles comprará mas productos agrícolas para luego venderlos a empresas más grandes.
texts.en:
Reyna is married and lives with her only child in her house, which is built out of high-quality materials.  After spending a good deal of time growing organic cacao she decided to take a more dynamic and commercial route and sell agricultural products in her community.  She's been at it for around 5 years and has managed to get herself known by local producers, from whom she buys and safely stores a variety of products like cacao, coffee, achiote, palillo [turmeric], and barbasco.  

She says she really appreciates her work because it's not such a strain but it's not so simple either, in that she has to be in contact with wholesalers in the city to get good prices for the products she'll be selling, which also benefits the local producers.   As harvest time for some products approaches, she wants to have financial backing to bring the business along.  She hopes to recoup her investment quickly, along with some extra profit.  This will be her first Kiva loan and she seems very happy and grateful for the opportunity because she can work with greater ease without neglecting to make payments on time.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products.

loans.name: Rhuzusanye Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mélanie est présidente  du collectif d’affaire  Rhuzusanye, entrepreneur,  âgée de 45  ans, mariée et mère de 9 enfants. Son conjoint est un constructeur (maitre maçon). La cliente est vendeuse des oignons. Elle commença cette affaire depuis sa jeunesse, avec  le fonds reçu de ses parents. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter  1 sac d’oignons.  Les détériorations, l’insécurité dans les milieux ruraux sont de défis majeurs pour son activité.  Elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants et accroitre l’entreprise. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit.
texts.en:
Mélanie, age 45, is an entrepreneur and the president of Rhuzusanye Group. She's married and the mother of nine children. Her husband is a builder (master mason).

Mélanie sells onions. She started this business in her youth, with funds she received from her parents. She will use her part of the new loan to buy one sack of onions.

Deteriorations and insecurity in rural environments are major challenges for her business. She would like to send her children to school and expand her business.

In conclusion, she greatly thanks Hekima for its support with microfinance.

loans.use: to buy one sack of onions

loans.name: Berta Lorenza

texts.es: Doña Berta de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia, ella tiene un puesto de pupuseria desde hace dos años cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela pues vende a buen precio las pupusas; con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, Doña Berta solicita un credito para poder comprar mas materiales para la elaboracion como: maiz, frijoles, aceite, quesillo, chicharron, gas, entre otras cosas y asi pueda obtener mejores ingresos que le ayudaran a solventar los gastos de su casa.
texts.en:
Berta, 41 years old, lives in her own home. She has had a pupusa stand for two years that is close to her residence. She has many customers since she sells the pupusas at a good price. With the profits that she earns she manages to settle the expenses she has at home.

Berta is requesting a loan to be able to buy more materials for production such as: corn, beans, oil, cheese, chicharron, and gas, among other things. She will be able to obtain a better income that will help her to settle her home expenses.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the production of pupusas, such as cheese, corn, beans, chicharron, etc.

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Chea, age 52, lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district in Cambodia. She is married and has seven children. For the last 10 years, Chea has been farming rice and growing sesame. The current business earns her about 33,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

Chea has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four cycles already, and she completely repaid the previous loans. She has used the past loans wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Wadhah

texts.en:
Wadhah is 29 years old, a single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. 

He has a small workshop, which he started six years ago with the goal of growing financially. He is very well known for his good quality service, and he has sufficient customer demand. 

Wadhah has requested a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy spare parts for his business. He is very happy and grateful for the support that he is receiving, and pledges to make his loan payments on time. This investment will meet the demand in his business. 

He plans to make the workshop larger so he can give his family financial well being.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his business.

loans.name: Ana De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Doña Ana de 45 años de edad, es una persona muy responsable quien trabaja junto a su esposo para darle lo mejor a sus cuatro hijos. Ana posee un negocio en su lugar de residencia en el cual elabora y vende platillos típicos como pupusas, atoles y demás. tiene varios años de tener su negocio por eso cuenta con mucha clientela, Doña Ana solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder aumentar sus ventas, ya que ella espera poder comprar, verduras, queso, maíz y todos los ingredientes necesarios para hacer los platillos, para poder brindarles un mejor servicio de comida a sus clientes y así mismo obtener nuevos clientes lo que le genera ganancias extras para darle un mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en: Ana is 45 years old and is a very responsible person who works with her husband to provide the best for their four children.  Ana has a home business where she makes and sells typical food dishes such as pupusas, atoles, and other things.  She has been doing this for several years, so she has many customers.  Ana is asking for this loan in order to increase her sales and wants to buy vegetables, cheese, dried corn, and all the ingredients she needs for her dishes, so that she can provide better service to her customers and also attract new customers.  The extra earnings will be used to provide a better life to her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Mary-Rose

texts.en:
Mary-Rose is 24 years old and single. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 

Mary-Rose owns and operates a planting and harvesting flower business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over three years, and earns 5,000 PHP every month. She has been with GDMPC since 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase chemicals for her flowers. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for her flower business.

loans.name: Las Perlas Y El Diamante Group

texts.es: Agueda, que está en la última fila al costado izquierdo, con los ojos cerrados porque esta riéndose y detrás de una señora de sweater verde, es una socia que pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Perlas y el Diamante, en el que hay distintos rubros, venta en ferias libres, venta de comida, venta de ropa usada y nueva y repostería, y en esto último es en lo que trabaja Agueda. Ella vende postres en ferias libres, empezó trabajando en un carro vendiendo palomitas de maíz hace tres o 4 años atrás, y hace dos años que trabaja de forma estable en las ferias vendiendo postres. Cuando ha tenido problemas ha podido recurrir a sus hermanos que le han ayudado cada vez que han podido para que ella pudiera comprar los materiales que necesitaba para hacer sus postres. Con el dinero que recibirá podrá comprar más insumos para hacer sus postres y también manzanas para hacer manzanas confitadas. Ella cree que en este nuevo ciclo podrá le irá muy bien y eso la tiene muy tranquila. Lo que más le gusta de trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de poder estar con sus amigas, con quienes ha conformado el Banco Comunal en el que está, ya que viven en el mismo barrio y se conocen desde siempre, y han sido quienes la han ayudado y apoyado cada vez que lo ha necesitado.
texts.en:
Agueda is standing in the back row, behind a lady wearing a green sweater. Her eyes are closed because she is smiling. Agueda is a member of the communal bank Las Perlas y el Diamante [The Pearls and the Diamond]. They all have different activities, like selling at fairs, food sales, used and new clothes sales, and bakery, which is what Agueda does for a living.

Agueda sells desserts in fairs. She started selling popcorn with a cart three or four years ago and she has been selling desserts for two years now. Her siblings have helped her whenever she has had problems to buy ingredients for her desserts. With the loan, she will be able to buy ingredients to make desserts and apples to make caramelized apples. She believes that everything will work fine in this new cycle, which gives her peace of mind.

What Agueda likes the most of working with Fondo Esperanza is the fact that she can spend time with her friends, with who she built this communal bank. They all live in the same neighborhood and have known each other forever, and have given support and help whenever someone has had the need.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her desserts.

loans.name: Sahei Lom Group

texts.en:
Hetin lives a very busy life since she lives with her in-laws and has to take care of them. She is a caring daughter-in-law. She takes care of her in-laws, kids and also raises pigs. She joined "Sahei lom" group with four other economically active women and she is the featured borrower member. She is pictured with the raised hand.

Hetin raise pigs but she was never in the position to buy more than three piglets. The insufficient capital always paralyses Hetin from raising pigs in good numbers. The pig sty that she has is also small and she needs more money to buy piglets and feed too. She raises pigs near the house because her in-laws are old and she can't leave them on their own. She purchase feed for the pigs in stocks from the market because she doesn't have time to collect food for the pigs in the nearby fields. She barely collects food for the pigs.

With the Kiva loan she is planning to purchase two more piglets and renovate the present pig sty by extending the perimeter. Hetin says if her plan is successful, then she will open a bank account and make some savings so that she can build a house. At present her only savings are with the group and it is a small savings. She is elated to share that, with the assistance of the loan, she will now be able to construct a bigger pig sty and purchase two more piglets. She thanks WSDS and Kiva for reaching her and also requests to continue assisting the "Sahei Lom" group in the future.

loans.use: To purchase two more piglets and construct a bigger pig sty.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Fidel is 51 years old; he is married with four children. He lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 

Fidel owns and operates a motorcycle transport service in the local community to earn a living. He has been in his business for over five years, and earns 15,000 PHP every month. 

He joined GDMPC in 2010, and now he has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Nkosinathi

texts.en:
Nkosinathi is a Business Management student at the Maharishi Institute. He is applying for a loan for his last year and a half of studies. Nkosinathi is 22 years old and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute:

What do you study at the Maharishi Institute and what classes do you enjoy most?

"Business Administration. I enjoy the maths class because it's where I get more knowledge on how to count because the study that I am doing is all about business."

What are your goals after graduation?

"My goal is to start my own business where I come from and I would love to work at KPMG Company in Johannesburg. I would love to go to travel the world because it's where I will gain more experience to conquer the skill that I have."

Tell us about your background?

"I was born in Kwazulu Natal in rural areas, I do have one sister, my father does work as a security guard and my mother she's not working. I'm not married and I don't have children."

What do you do in your spare time?

"I like to play soccer and go to positive living group because I believe these two things that I mentioned they made a huge development in me because the take me away from bad things like alcohol, drugs and stealing."

How will the Kiva Loan change your life?

"If I can get this loan from Kiva it will be highly appreciated in me because I struggle a lot when when it comes to pay for my fees and with Kiva Loan I can change my lifestyle because I will put more effort into my studies to get my degree. Maybe I can carry on with my masters."

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. She has four children and has been doing this work for 13 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

She will use the loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow.

Agnes stated what is most enjoyable about farming is, 'Rearing livestock!' Her biggest challenge is, 'Low production due to low-yielding dairy animals.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Cheluk.'  Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. 

Agnes was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, and she said: 'Was first introduced to Juhudi by a friend.'  This client was also asked what she learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'How I could boost production through acquisition of assets from an mfi.'  When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Agnes replied 'Will acquire a high yielding dairy animal.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Agnes owns the following: cow, poultry, motorcycle, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ahed

texts.en:
Ahed is a single Palestinian young man. He is a worker in a carpentry workshop and earns a small salary that is barely enough to cover his needs. He is also a university student who wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Ahed do his homework and reports and help him in his studies. This will ensure a better future for Ahed and improve his living conditions. 

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending help text: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase a new laptop.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 22-year-old single young man. He is employed and earns a small salary that is not enough to cover his needs. He is also a university student who wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help him do his homework and reports and help him in his work. This will ensure a better future for him and improve his living conditions. Mohammad appears in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a new laptop.

loans.name: Claudia Margarita

texts.es:
La Sra. Claudia tiene viviendo en Piedras Negras desde hace 26 años, es madre de dos hijos, un niño y una niña la cuál tiene una enfermedad que la atienden cada mes en la cd. de Monterrey, ella junto a su esposo han tratado de apoyar a su hija en todo momento, a darle la mejor cómodidad para que se sienta bien.
La Sra. Claudia se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, negocio que acaba de empezar  ya que anteriormente contaba con él pero en cuanto a su hija se le detecto diabetes tuvo que cerrarlo pués realizaba muchas vueltas a la cd. de Monterrey, y no tenía tiempo de atenderlo.
Pide apoyo a través de KIVA para poder surtir más ropa usada al igual que nueva para generar  ingreso y así darle lo mejor a sus hijos, la Sra. Claudia ha sido una madre y esposa responsable durante todo este tiempo y quiere seguir haciendolo ayudando con los gastos a su esposo apoyandolo en todo momento, saliendo adelante como familia que se apoya en las buenas y las malas.
texts.en:
Claudia has lived in Piedras Negras since she was 26 years old. She is the mother of two children, one boy and one girl who has a disease that they attend to each month in the city of Monterrey. She, along with her husband, has tried to support her daughter all of the time to give her the best comfort so that she feels good.

Claudia works in used clothing sales, a business that she just began. Previously she had the same business, but when her daughter was diagnosed with diabetes, she had to close it. She had to travel to the city of Monterrey many times and did not have time to attend to her business.

She is requesting support through Kiva to be able to supply more used clothing along with new clothing to generate an income and thus give the best to her children. Claudia has been a responsible mother and wife during this time and wants to continue doing so, helping with the expenses, supporting her husband all of the time, and going on as a family that supports itself in good times and bad.

loans.use: to supply her business with used and new clothing.

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam, who appears in the photo, is a 48-year-old married man and a father to two sons and two daughters. He is employed and gets a small salary that is barely enough to cover the family's needs.

He is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing new bedroom furniture in order to improve the living conditions in his house. Taking this loan will offer to Bassam and his wife comfortable furniture so both of them can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: To buy new bedroom furniture.

loans.name: Rashel

texts.en:
Rashel is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother to three sons and one daughter. Her husband works in agriculture, planting different types of vegetables.

For the past four years, Rashel has had a cosmetics store. She is well known among her customers and has a good reputation, which makes her project a profitable one, but she needs more support to expand and make some improvements.

Rashel is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of installing shelves and purchasing a new collection of cosmetics to sell. This will allow her to expand the scope of her work, improve her business and increase the family's income. Rashel is photographed in her store.

loans.use: To make new decorations and buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Enas

texts.en:
Enas is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother to three sons and two daughters. For the past five years, Enas and her husband have been working in agriculture with the rest of the family members, which is a profitable project and the only source of income for the family. 

Now Enas needs more support for improvements. She wants to contribute to the purchase of a greenhouse. She is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to provide a share of the family's costs of purchasing the greenhouse. It will allow them to produce a better crop and thus increase their sales and improve the family's income.

Enas is photographed in the picture with her husband and one of their daughters.

loans.use: To buy a greenhouse for agriculture.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, who appears in the photo, is a 28-year-old single young man. He is an Accountant in the Council of the village where he lives and earns a low salary that is barely enough to cover all his needs.

He has completed building his own house, and now he wants to finish it, so he is requesting a 1,000 USD Youth loan to help him cover the cost of installing new windows and doors on his house.

Taking this loan will offer Mohammad suitable home conditions so he can enjoy living in his house soon.

loans.use: To install new windows and doors on the house.

loans.name: Airene

texts.en:
Airene is 24 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by cultivating seaweed in the Philippines. Airene has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from selling gasoline and from food vending. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional seeds, bamboo, wood, etc. for her business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, bamboo, wood, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elisa works hard to support her family. She has a fish-selling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling squid.  Elisa is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish selling business.

Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Feleciana

texts.en:
Feleciana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has business buying and selling sea cucumbers in the Philippines. 

Feleciana is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of sea cucumbers to sell. Feleciana has been in this business for five years and earns more income from fishing.

Feleciana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of sea cocumbers to sell

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en:
Arlen is 19 years old and single. She earns a living by cultivating seaweed in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her business, like nylon, bamboo, wood, etc. Arlen is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business, like nylon, bamboo, wood, etc.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, three of whom are  in school, Arlene works hard to support her family. She has a buying and selling of dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing and seaweed culture. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. Arlene hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from fishing and seaweeds culture.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Catalina dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Ntahalia Group

texts.fr: La cliente Chiregano est conseillère  du collectif d’affaire Ntahalia, jeune entrepreneur dynamique,  âgée de 29  ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Son conjoint est un chauffeur taximan. La cliente est vendeuse des fruits. Toute fois, elle vend aussi d’autres produits alimentaires (Maïs, ignames, haricots, etc.). Elle installe ses produits au marché et parfois à son domicile. Elle commença cette affaire depuis sa jeunesse, avec  le fonds reçu de son grand père. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter  2 paniers des fruits prunes, 10 régimes de bananes,  2 bassins d’oranges, avocats, etc.  Les détériorations, les pourritures de fruits, absence de technologie de conservation,  l’insécurité dans les milieux ruraux sont de défis majeurs pour son activité.  Elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants et accroitre l’entreprise. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit
texts.en:
The client Chiregano is the adviser for the business collective of Ntahalia. Chiregano is a dynamic young entrepreneur, 29 years old, and married with four children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Chiregano is a fruit seller. All the same, she also sells other food products (corn, yams, beans, etc.). Chiregano sells her merchandise in the market and sometimes from her home.

Chiregano started this business in her youth, with funds received from her grandfather. This new loan will be used to buy two baskets of plums, ten bunches of bananas, two baskets of oranges, avocados, etc.

Damage to the produce, rotting fruit, a lack of conservation technology, and insecurity in rural areas are major challenges for her business. Chiregano hopes to educate her children and help her business to grow. Chiregano would also like to give special thanks to Hekima for her micro loan support.

loans.use: to buy two baskets of plums, ten bunches of bananas, two baskets of oranges, avocados, etc.

loans.name: Hodeliza

texts.en:
Hodeliza is 25 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, snack foods, spices, noodles, soft drinks, etc.

Hodeliza has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling  distilled water and charcoal.

Hodeliza aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, snack foods, spices, noodles, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Jinelda

texts.en:
Jinelda is married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jinelda is 32 years old and five of her children are in school.

Jinelda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

Jinelda has been in this business for six years. In the future, Jinelda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Joesita

texts.en:
Joesita is 29 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by growing seaweed in the Philippines. Joesita is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional seaweed seeds, bamboo, wood, etc.

Joesita has been culturing seaweed for 10 years and also earns additional income from fishing and buying and selling seaweed.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional seaweed seeds, bamboo, wood, etc.

loans.name: Diego Alejandro

texts.es:
Diego Alejandro  de 23 años de edad, es un joven apasionado por su trabajo, asegura que la mecánica se convirtió en un gran reto para el. Comenzó a laborar desde los 15 años es un pequeño taller, allí aprendió de la actividad y desde hace seis meses logró montar en compañía con su familia su propio negocio. Uno de sus mayores sueños es  ingresar a la universidad y graduarse como ingeniero, por lo cual se encuentra ahorrando para iniciar con su proyecto de vida. 
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de parches, calibradores y herramientas de mano, con el fin de mejorar la calidad en el servicio. Espera que con dicha inversión pueda aumentar sus ingresos y pagar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Diego Alejandro, age 23, is a young man who is passionate about his work. He has taken on a great challenge with mechanics. He started working at the age of 15 in a small workshop, where he learned this job. Six months ago, he was able to open his own business with his family. One of his greatest dreams is to go to university and graduate with an engineering degree. He is saving up to start this life project. 
He is currently requesting a loan for the purchase of patches, gauges, and hand tools. His goal is to improve the quality of his service. With this investment, he hopes to increase his income and pay for his studies.

loans.use: to buy patches, gauges, and hand tools.

loans.name: Italo Antonio

texts.es: Don italo de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa el se dedica a la reparacion de todo tipo de maquinas de coser industriales, electricas o manuales con las reparaciones que realiza logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar, Don italo solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar mas repuestos de muy buena calidad para seguir con su trabajo y sastifacer a sus clientes asi el podra tener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran en su hogar.
texts.en: Don Italo, age 54, lives in his own home with his wife. He repairs all kinds of industrial sewing machines, electric or manual. These repairs allow him to cover his household costs. Italo is requesting a loan which will allow him to be able to buy more spare parts of very good quality in order to continue with his work and satisfy his customers. This way, he will have more income to help his household.

loans.use: to buy pieces of machinery.

loans.name: Rosa Esther

texts.es: La señora Rosa, habita en el municipio de Masaya en el Comarca llamada Sacuanjoche, junto a su familia e hijos, mujer trabajadora desde muy joven, su mayor prioridad hoy en dia son sus hijos y darle  las mejores condicones posibles, ella tiene un negocio hubicado en su casa de habitacion, que es elaboracion de Pan, ella distribuye su producto a todas las pulperias del municipio y vende en su casa tambien, con este negocio a sacado adelante a su familia y ha ayudado a otras familias ya que emplea a 4 personas y asi ayuda en la comunidad, con este credito compra Materia prima como:Arina, Levadura, Sartenes , Leche, Azucar, Manteca, Leña etc. Agradece el Apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa lives in the municipality of Masaya, in a region called Sacuanjoche, with her family and children. She has been a hard-working woman from a very young age. Her greatest priority now is her children: to give them the best possible conditions. She has a business in her home, making bread. She distributes her product to all the general stores in the municipality and also sells from home. With this business, she has gotten her family ahead and also helped other families; she employs four people, thus helping out in the community.
With this loan, she will buy basic supplies such as: flour, yeast, pans, milk, sugar, butter, and firewood. She is grateful for the support of Afodenic and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 46 years old, married, and has three children.  She earns a living by selling seaweed cultured in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 23 years.  She also earns additional income from fishing. 

Marina is requesting a loan from NWTF for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase materials such as wood, nylon, bamboo, etc.  She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as wood, nylon, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Jhon Fredy

texts.es:
Jhon Fredy de 39 años de edad se ha dedicado durante toda su vida a la venta de frutas y verduras de manera ambulante, recorre diariamente las calles de su barrio y otros sectores cercanos. Desde hace 4 años logró obtener el permiso para comercializar sus productos. Labora de 7:00 am a 6:00 pm de lunes a sábado.  
En la actualidad desea cambiar su carrera debido al mal estado en el que se encuentra e invertir en la compra de surtido con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. En un futuro próximo desea tener su negocio en un punto fijo y generar empleos directos a su familia.
texts.en:
Jhon Fredy, age 39, has dedicated his whole life to the sale of fruits and vegetables on the street. He walks the streets of his neighbourhood and the surrounding sectors every day. Four years ago, he was able to obtain permission to sell his products. He works from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm Monday to Saturday. 
He now wants to change his cart because it is in bad shape. He also wants to invest in the purchase of more stock in order to increase his income and improve his family's quality of life. In the near future he wants to have his business at a fixed location and generate a direct income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a cart and fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
As a married mother of five, Carolina works hard to support her family. She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing, operating a general store and selling cultured seaweeds.

Carolina, who has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF, is now borrowing PHP 25000 to buy additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, yeast, margarine, etc. for her bakery. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, margarine, etc.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge a sus 52 años, se caracteriza por se un hombre luchador y esmerado por salir adelante. Trabaja en su propia tienda desde hace más de 5 años, en la que genera el sustento diario para el y su familia. Actualmente, el señor jorge requiere de la compra de productos de la canasta familiar con el fin de suplir la demanda de sus clientes,  lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Su mayor sueño es tener su tienda bien surtida y fidelizar sus clientes.
texts.en: At the age of 52, Jorge is noted for being a hardworking man who is focused on getting ahead.  He has worked in his own store for more than five years; it generates daily support for him and his family.  At present, Jorge needs to buy basic staple items to meet customer demand.  This will make it possible for him to increase his income and improve his family’s quality of life.  His greatest dream is to have a well-stocked store and to secure his customers’ regular patronage.

loans.use: to buy basic staples to stock his store.

loans.name: Cristian George

texts.es:
Cristian es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Cristian no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, pero le gustaría poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su madre, Cristian trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros.
